so i've only been on facebook for about 3 weeks and it's literally eating up all my online time. it's pretty sad...livejournal used to take that place...now i find myself searching for people with whom i most likely haven't spoken in years, (be)friending them, and then having these little message conversations going back and forth for days at a time. it's the most bizarre concept, really...i suppose if you ask most people they believe i'm simply wasting my time. the past is the past and that's where it should stay, but sometimes i'd like to rekindle or retain that connection. it serves as a reminder of who i am and how far i've come, or like to say i have at least. besides, it's kind of fun to see where people end up...

...all the things to let her know you care...

1. Tell her she is beautiful.

2. Hold her hand at any moment even if its  just for a second.

3. Kiss her on the forehead.

4. Leave her voice messages to wake up to.

5. Always tell her you love her at any and all times.

6. When she is upset hold her tight and tell her how much

she means to you.

7. Recognize the small things . . . they usually mean the most.

8. Call her sweetie.  {Not baby}

9. Sing to her no matter how horrible your voice is.

10. Pick her over all the others you hang out with.

11. Write her notes. {She loves them}

12. Introduce her to family and friends as your girlfriend.

13. Play with her hair.

14. Pick her up, tickle her and play-wrestle with her.

15. Sit in the park and just talk to her.

16. Tell her funny jokes; tell her stupid jokes, just tell her jokes.

17. Throw pebbles at her window in the middle of the night just because

you missed her.

18. Let her fall asleep in your arms.

19. Carve your names into a tree.

20. If she's mad at you, kiss her.

21. Give her piggyback rides.

22. Bring her flowers just because.

23. Treat her the same around your friends as you do when

you're alone.,

24. Look her in the eyes and smile.

25. Let her take as many pictures of you as she wants.

26. Slow dance with her, even if there isn't any music playing.

27. Kiss her in the rain.

28. If you're in love with her . . . tell her

this is what happens when i procrastinate studying for my 3 exams :-p...oh well, i have til wednesday

*bowled a 107 and a 142...yea baby! *saw rob kozak and his mom on channel 2 news since he came home from iraq today :) since my family and i have been keeping in contact with his family we were wondering when hed be back *oh yes, and although this may not be considered something great, pete overflowed my toilet...way to go ;-)...at least my floor got washed without me having to do it, right? lol way to put a positive spin on things! *got out of my night class an hour early :) *my abnormal psyc test went well *i did my reference page for my abnormal psyc paper and i finished my formal outline for my 20-30 page scholars paper *oh yes, and last but not least, one of my roommates bought porn :-p on the down side john olson, a 2001 graduate of eghs, was killed in iraq...even though i didnt know him, it still feels so awkward...so sad... wow, what a mixed bag of events that was

You Know You're From Illinois When... 
You know if someone is from southern, middle or northern Illinois as soon as they open their mouth. 

When you say "the city" - you mean Chicago. 

You think ethanol makes your truck "run a lot better." 

You know what's knee-high by the Fourth of July. Stores don't have bags; they have sacks. 

All the festivals across the state are named after a fruit, vegetable, grain, or animal. 

You think of the major four food groups as beef, pork, soddie, and Jell-O salad with marshmallows. 

You know what "cow tipping" and "snipe hunting" is. 

You spent a good deal of your high school nights hanging out at DQ. 

"Vacation" means going to Six Flags. 

You don't pronounce the "S" in Illinois like the rest of the world. 

Whenever anyone mentions going out for steak, the first place you think of is Ponderosa. 

You know more than one person with a septic tank. 

You pronounce the invisible "R" in the word wash. 

Down south to you means Kentucky 

You have no problem spelling or pronouncing "Des Plaines" 

You think Chicago is a completely different state from Illinois. 

You know the answer to the question, "Is this Heaven?" 

You know where all the Yoders live 

Detassling was your first job 

You've ever been on a "Geode Hunt" 

Your idea of a really great tenderloin is when the meat is twice as big as the bun and accompanied only by ketchup and a dill pickle slice 

You learn your pickup will run without a muffler 

When asked how your trip was to any foreign, exotic place, you say, "It was different." 

You consider being called a "Pork Queen" an honor 

People from other states love to hear you say "Illinois" and other words with "Os" in them. 

Your dream vacation is a trip to Rock Home Gardens 

You drink "pop." 

You actually get these jokes and pass them on to other friends from Illinois.

its nights like yesterday that make me not want to leave yet... thank you donna for acting all loopy at 1am. thank you for serenading us with your *so* impressive piano skills. thank you donna for being late...to everything :-p thank you moy for always having a positive attitude...and reminding me to be the same way. thank you donna for always asking if i needed anything at dominicks when ever you were making a trip. thank you moy for the many hours we have killed chatting after dinner(s). haha thank you alisa for being you and always being around...and for letting my inner kid shine through especially during kickball. theres so much i can say to you, but im sure you already know it all. thank you pete for laughing at me when i have no idea why:) today after 1215, i am officially done with my sophomore year. the past two years have gone by so fast, almost as if its a dream and i just woke up. im excited its over, but just yesterday it hit me...im sad that ill have to be away from so many great people over the summer. there was a time last nite, where just for a moment, i was filled with sadness. thats so unlike me...but it made me realize that i have made good friends with some people here, and although the next few months may bring us to different places in our lives, i hope each of them will still have room for me. :) youre all amazing; thank you for all the memories. this expresses Movin', we're gettin' out Movin', without a doubt Movin', we're goin' far We're movin', oh yes we are Nobody knows there Nobody shows where Nobody goes where you can find me Nobody knows there Nobody shows where ondrak room 227...youve served me well :-p
